channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024050459
item.description:
Report E-2024050459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon poly drum containing Dupham SPD. The drum was punctured in a forklift accident. This resulted in approximately 4-gallons of product releasing onto the wooden trailer floor, the steel apron, and the concrete dock floor. The surface areas were impacted as follows: Trailer Floor: 8'x3'/ Dock: 6'x6' / Apron: 6'x3'. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking drum into one 85- gallon DF. The release was neutralized and cleaned-up using oil dry. The spill debris was containerized into a one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident

item.title: Report E-2024050326
item.description:
Report E-2024050326

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty (50) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbents to the impacted area. The damaged drum and the spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050344
item.description:
Report E-2024050344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2024, one (1) 1,000-pound supersack of UN3077 was torn in transit by a load strap failure and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged supersack and utilized a HEPA vacuum to collect all product. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A HAZMAT LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. USING THE DECISION TREE, CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHETT AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE AND RELATED SPILL DEBRIS WERE TRANSPORTED TO PSC AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024050341
item.description:
Report E-2024050341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver had a damaged placard on side of trailer and stopped to get it fixed and the shop drilled out the rivet holding the placard on to replace it and drilled through the wall of the trailer and pierced the side of the tote at approximately 1030et. They immediately plugged the hole and a crew was sent out to transfer the material to a new tote to be transported. The material that was released was cleaned up with absorbent and then disposed of properly.
